Name: Relief of Offering Bearers of Tjanefer
Description: This scene depicts a row of offering bearers marching toward the tomb's owner, who is seated on the left, facing a vertical line of inscription. The text contains his name "Tjanefer son of Psammetik-Ankh, and born to the lady Newbtiti."Tjanefer is shown wearing a garment wrapped around his body and fastened at the shoulder, covering his shoulder and arm. He is holding a long rod in his left hand. The row of offering bearers consists of nine men and women who bring geese, jars, cattle, birds, and lotuses. The men are wearing short kilts and the women are dressed in tight garments, while the last and youngest person in the line is shown naked.
